definition: class/rank/grade/equal to/same as/to wait for/to await/et cetera/and so on/et al. (and other authors)/after/as soon as/once

sentences.english: This god was not identified with nature.
sentences.chinese: 上帝已經不再等同於自然了。

sentences.english: Using a grease pencil or equivalent, make alignment marks on the glass and body.
sentences.chinese: 使用油筆或其它等同物，在玻璃與車體上作出標記。

sentences.english: Did either party emphasize the relationship as much as the settlement?
sentences.chinese: 有認何一方把結果等同於關係來重視呢？

sentences.english: Their veto was tantamount to terrorism.
sentences.chinese: 他說這五個國家手中的否決權就等同於恐怖主義。

sentences.english: For schistosomiasis: xiong huang with nan gua zi (pumpkin seeds), bin nang.
sentences.chinese: 血吸蟲病，可與南瓜子，檳榔等同用。

sentences.english: Do you equate love with pain?
sentences.chinese: 你是否把愛情與痛苦等同起來了？

sentences.english: Chinese salaries may only equal blue collar pay abroad.
sentences.chinese: 中國的工資可能只等同於國外藍領的收入水平。

sentences.english: Humility is not modesty either, Tangney argues.
sentences.chinese: Tangney認爲謙遜也不等同於謙虛。

sentences.english: The proposal for a level playing field demands, of course, equal education.
sentences.chinese: 等同地位競爭的提議，需要平等教育。

sentences.english: The consciousness equaled to praxis. The proletarian consciousness was the real motive of history.
sentences.chinese: 意識等同於實踐，無產階級意識是歷史的真正動力。

sentences.english: Density can be equated to karma and patterns that are non-unity-based.
sentences.chinese: 緻密可被等同於基於不統一的業力和模式。

sentences.english: Stephen King once called himself the literary equivalent of a Big Mac and fries.
sentences.chinese: 金曾稱他自己的文學作品爲等同於大漢堡和炸薯條。

sentences.english: Why is this the transmittable disease whose transmission equates to criminality?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼這種病毒傳染源就等同於犯罪呢？

sentences.english: What about equating money with love?
sentences.chinese: 那麼，將金錢等同於愛又是爲何？

sentences.english: Circumventing the toolset is equivalent to challenging that person.
sentences.chinese: 繞過工具集等同於對那個人挑戰。

sentences.english: One tiny acerola cherry has vitamin C equal to that found in four oranges.
sentences.chinese: 一顆小小的針葉櫻桃，其維他命C含量等同四個鮮橙。

definition: nothing other than/to differ in no way from/the same as/to amount to
equal to/having the same social class or status
to confuse one thing with another (idiom); to muddle
to regard as/to look upon as
two quite different things/two unrelated matters
to look upon as/to regard as
